--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Stephen Connolly
<stephen.alan.connolly@...> wrote:
> JUnit sees itself as purely for Unit tests.
I know, I know... JUnit and me never quite agreed on that, and while
JUnit doesn't want to be used that way, I still do, and am happy with
the results.

> What I have wanted to see in JUnit is a way to mark smoke tests for
> features. If the smoke test fails then all the tests that cover that
> feature would be skipped.
>
> The danger of such support is that it would be tempting to abuse for
> sequencing tests ;-)

Use, abuse... :-)
Anyway, my original question was not as much on making it possible (we
already have custom Runners in our toolbox), as on making it easy using
the latest and greatest shiny feature. Instead, we'll probably just use
the simple mechanism of  sortable method names ("test010_runFirst",
"test050_runFifith", etc). Quick, easy, and good enough.
